intro: Pyrola rugosa, commonly known as the rough pyrola, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. Native to the northeastern United States and southeastern Canada, it thrives in moist, acidic soils in shaded forest environments. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for woodland gardens and conservation efforts.
